free_text.Learning outcomes: Give the student the basic notions in physics that will allow him to have a better understanding of the physical effects he/she is bound to encounter during his professional life. The student should be able to use the appropriate tools to estimate the consequences of the different effects with the appropriate theoretical tools.
free_text.Content: [b]Quantum physics, and quantum mechanics:[/b][br/]Introduction to the basics of quantum mechanics. Basics of atomic physics, introduction to solid state physics.[br/][br/][b]Molecular physics:[/b][br/]Physical properties of molecules, interactions between molecules and macromolecules.[br/][br/][b]Introduction to nuclear physics:[/b][br/]Atomic nucleus, radioactivity, fission, fusion, principles of nuclear magnetic resonance.[br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra with demonstrations and exercises supervised
